definition: to fall behind/to lag (in technology etc)/backward/to retrogress
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
a blade will get rusty if it is not sharpened; a man will fall behind if he doesn't study (idiom)
pinyin: dao1 bu4 mo2 yao4 sheng1 xiu4 , ren2 bu4 xue2 yao4 luo4 hou4
containing_words.word: 刀不磨要生锈，人不学要落后

definition: economically backward
Modesty leads to progress, arrogance makes you drop behind (favorite slogan of Mao Zedong)
pinyin: xu1 xin1 shi3 ren2 jin4 bu4 , jiao1 ao4 shi3 ren2 luo4 hou4
containing_words.word: 虚心使人进步，骄傲使人落后

sentences.english: But in Afro-Asian areas, the solution is not put enough attention.
sentences.chinese: 但是亚非落后地区的饮水状况却没有得到人们的重视。

sentences.english: China’s 12 western provinces and regions remain relatively underdeveloped in terms of economy and social development.
sentences.chinese: 中国西部的12个省区，经济社会发展水平相对落后。

sentences.english: The milestone date was quickly approaching, but teams were falling behind.
sentences.chinese: 要求的日期不断逼近，但是团队还落后于进程。

sentences.english: Latin America has a couple of candidates, but they are trailing.
sentences.chinese: 拉丁美洲有许多候选人，但是他们正在落后。

sentences.english: If you are getting behind, talk to your teacher or counselor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你落后了，就找你的老师或顾问聊聊。

sentences.english: fishing and subsistence farming, by contrast, are reminders of a backward past.
sentences.chinese: 而农耕捕鱼则让人想起落后的过去。

sentences.english: I am afraid of falling behind others in the examination .
sentences.chinese: 我害怕在考试中落后于其他人。

sentences.english: New York City lags well behind other cities in green space.
sentences.chinese: 纽约的城市绿化已经落后于其他城市了。

sentences.english: Or will a region that fears innovation inevitably fall behind?
sentences.chinese: 还是说，这个忌惮创新的地区终将落后于人呢？

sentences.english: They twice came from a goal down to beat Bolton 3-2 at Goodison Park.
sentences.chinese: 在葛迪逊公园球场两度落后下以三比二反胜保顿。

sentences.english: The ranking results of Taiwanese universities could also have been adversely affected by the following.
sentences.chinese: 台湾的大学排名落后，原因有如下数端。

sentences.english: In 2010Q2, Avene was only slightly behind Lancome.
Jingdong mall also unwilling to lag behind.
The cat learned the physical skills quickly and the tiger was always behind.
sentences.chinese: 猫学习动作技巧涸旗，老虎却总是落后。

sentences.english: Palermo and rumblings of a proposal from southern city Bari followed.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒莫和南部城市巴里也不甘落后地表示了申办意愿。

sentences.english: We made it more difficult for ourselves because we were 1-0 down.
sentences.chinese: 由于我们0比1落后使得比赛变得很困难。

definition: to lead/to be in front
to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
score
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission
inferior/disadvantaged
half of a game or contest/half-court
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
bellwether
no match for/cannot beat
to turn back/to reverse
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
economically backward
to approach/to press in
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
